chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type

Goal:
forall P Q : Ensemble A, Included Q (Union A P Q)

Premises:
Ensemble = fun U : Type => U -> Prop : Type -> Type Argument scope is [type_scope]
Record Q : Set := Qmake { Qnum : BinNums.Z; Qden : BinNums.positive } For Qmake: Argument scopes are [Z_scope positive_scope]
Union : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Ensemble U
Included = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
Union_Included : forall P Q R : Ensemble ?A, Included (Union ?A P Q) R < -> Included P R /\ Included Q R where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
left_Included_Union : forall P Q : Ensemble ?A, Included P (Union ?A P Q) where ?A : [A : Type |- Type]
Union_assoc : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Union A (Union A P Q) R) (Union A P (Union A Q R))
Union_comm : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Union A P Q) (Union A Q P)
Intersection_Union_distr_r : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P (Union A Q R)) (Union A (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A P R))
Disjoint_spec : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Disjoint A P Q < -> (forall x : A, P x -> Q x -> False)
Same_set_spec : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set P Q < -> pointwise_relation A iff P Q
Intersection_Union_distr_l : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Union A Q R) P) (Union A (Intersection A Q P) (Intersection A R P))
Union_spec : forall (A : Type) (v : A) (P Q : Ensemble A), Union A P Q v < -> P v \/ Q v
Intersection_spec : forall (A : Type) (v : A) (P Q : Ensemble A), Intersection A P Q v < -> P v /\ Q v
Intersection_Complement : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Complement A P) (Complement A Q)) (Complement A (Union A P Q))
Intersection_assoc : forall (A : Type) (P Q R : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A (Intersection A P Q) R) (Intersection A P (Intersection A Q R))
Intersection_comm : forall (A : Type) (P Q : Ensemble A), Same_set (Intersection A P Q) (Intersection A Q P)
Included_Full_set : forall (A : Type) (P : Ensemble A), Included P (Full_set A)
list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
Included_Empty : forall (U : Type) (A : Ensemble U), Included (Empty_set U) A
Inductive Forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Forall_nil : List.Forall P nil | Forall_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> List.Forall P (x :: l) For Forall: Argument A is implicit For Forall_nil: Argument A is implicit For Forall_cons: Arguments A, P, l are implicit For Forall: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope list_scope] For Forall_nil: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope] For Forall_cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ list_scope _ _]
BinPos.Pos.iter_invariant : forall (p : BinNums.positive) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (Inv : A -> Prop), (forall x : A, Inv x -> Inv (f x)) -> forall x : A, Inv x -> Inv (BinPos.Pos.iter f x p)
Union_iff : forall (U : Type) (A B : Ensemble U) (x : U), In U (Union U A B) x < -> In U A x \/ In U B x
List.Forall_cons : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> List.Forall P l -> List.Forall P (x :: l)
List.Forall_nil : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop), List.Forall P nil
Same_set_rel_Reflexive = fun A : Type => Same_set_refl A : forall A : Type, Reflexive Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Same_set_rel_Symmetric = fun A : Type => Same_set_sym A : forall A : Type, Symmetric Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Same_set_rel_Transitive = fun A : Type => Same_set_trans A : forall A : Type, Transitive Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree_ind : forall P : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree -> Prop, P FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Leaf -> (forall t : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree, P t -> forall (b : bool) (t0 : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree), P t0 -> P (FSetPositive.PositiveSet.Node t b t0)) -> forall t : FSetPositive.PositiveSet.tree, P t
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0 -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
Inductive prod (A B : Type) : Type := pair : A -> B -> A * B For pair: Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted For prod: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For pair: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _ _]
Same_set = fun (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) => Included B C /\ Included C B : forall U : Type, Ensemble U -> Ensemble U -> Prop Argument U is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope _ _]
BinInt.Z.bi_induction : forall P : BinNums.Z -> Prop, Proper (BinInt.Z.eq ==> iff) P -> P BinNums.Z0 -> (forall x : BinNums.Z, P x <-> P (BinInt.Z.succ x)) -> forall z : BinNums.Z, P z
Same_set_rel_relation = fun A : Type => {| |} : forall A : Type, RewriteRelation Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Decidable.dec_not_not : forall P : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> (~ P -> False) -> P
Strict_Included_intro : forall (U : Type) (X Y : Ensemble U), Included X Y /\ X <> Y -> Strict_Included U X Y
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A For cons: Arguments are renamed to A, a, l For nil: Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted For cons: Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted For list: Argument scope is [type_scope] For nil: Argument scope is [type_scope] For cons: Argument scopes are [type_scope _ list_scope]
Union_ind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> Prop), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union U B C u -> P u
Union_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> P x) -> (forall x : U, In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Union U B C u -> P u
snd = fun (A B : Type) (p : A * B) => let (_, y) := p in y : forall A B : Type, A * B -> B Arguments A, B are implicit and maximally inserted Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope _]
Same_set_rel = fun A : Type => {| Equivalence_Reflexive := Same_set_refl A; Equivalence_Symmetric := Same_set_sym A; Equivalence_Transitive := Same_set_trans A |} : forall A : Type, Equivalence Same_set Argument A is implicit and maximally inserted Argument scope is [type_scope]
Included_proper : forall V : Type, Proper (Same_set ==> Same_set ==> iff) Included
OmegaLemmas.fast_Zred_factor6 : forall (x : BinNums.Z) (P : BinNums.Z -> Prop), P (BinInt.Z.add x BinNums.Z0) -> P x
Intersection_sind : forall (U : Type) (B C : Ensemble U) (P : U -> SProp), (forall x : U, In U B x -> In U C x -> P x) -> forall u : U, Intersection U B C u -> P u

```coq
intros P Q x Hx.
unfold Included. intros y Hy.
right. apply Hy.
Qed.```
